review.body:
Not so good

Hard to believe the best were that bad. And a fire truck to open the gate not good. Bad ending

Los Hollister es la serie de libros que me inició definitivamente en la lectura. Recuerdo haber leído el primero y, con todo el dinero que había ahorrado por mi primera comunión y en todos los años anteriores, ir a por los 32 restantes, que costaban 600 pelas cada uno. Los compré todos en la feri...

Alexandre Dumas avait pour but en écrivant “La San Felice” de démontrer pourquoi on peut pas imposer la démocratie militairement. Dans le troisième tome, Dumas explique finallement sa logique. D'après Dumas les gens qui vivent sous un régime tyrannique désirent l'indépendance (les moyens de faire...
Meh. Beach read at best.

book.title: Made for Goodness: And Why This Makes All the Difference

review.body: Excellent book!

book.title: The Balfour Declaration: The Origins of the Arab-Israeli Conflict

review.body:
This is a very well written account of a highly complex episode of diplomacy.
I thoroughly enjoyed the read. The writer has done an excellent job in explicating all the threads of this entangled history. He did this by taking each thread, each piece of the jigsaw and painting the picture in imagin...

Marie's Tempting Reads Netgalley ARC Review:

A suspenseful story with high-octane romance and lots of thrills! Malone is full alpha male: Gorgeous, take-charge, and sinful while Abby is sweet, kind, and full of spirit. Risk of Exposure puts SEALS as the number one sexiest military men out there.

E...
Fun book. Woman going from a power job in Washington to helping keep her family's clinic going.

Oh my goodness, what can I say about this book? I'm not sure if I can come up with the adequate words to describe my feelings on this book. I first want to say this was actually my very first book I have read of Mrs. Faiman's. I have helped out on some book releases on my blog, but have yet to ac...

book.title: A Mother's Reckoning: Living in the Aftermath of Tragedy

review.body: Well written. Such an unimaginable thing for this family, no more of a review to include.

Much has been written about how Stephen King’s mind works. From multi-generational horror of It, to the locked-up ghosts of eternity of Doctor Sleep, to the alcoholic isolation of The Shining, King writes monsters as terrifying as anyone. What King does better, as these novels also show, is peopl...

It is no secret that I'm a fan of this series. When I first noticed there would be a m/m story as we found out one of the Pack members found his mate in a human nurse at the compound, I was extremely giddy. Especially because he was rejecting the idea completely and I thought that would make for...
This book is quietly powerful. In parts I found it even boring. Only nearing the end did I begin to realize all that is left unsaid. In fact I started over again immediately upon finishing.
we need more about Conrad!!!!!

book.title: The Lazy Man's Way To Enlightenment: What You're Looking For Is What Is Looking

review.body:
This is a great book if you want to find out about what enlightenment is.
It is not a how to book, but more a description of the enlightenment experience.
He covers it from a lot of different angles: it is the same thing but here described from the point of view of Awareness and there from the poin...

book.title: The Sisters Are Alright: Changing the Broken Narrative of Black Women in America

review.body: Used this as a research text and fell right into the dynamic and engaging narrative. A must-read!!!

book.title: From Thoughts To Written Words: Learn To Journal From The Soul

review.body:
While sitting on my own coffee shop promenade, I began to read Vince Guaglione’s most recent work in hopes of finding inspiration towards a new and creative means of self-expression.

Consistent with his previous publications, the author continues speaking casually to the reader and is honest abou...

Great read.

I really enjoyed this story. Great Time travel romances are a hard to find, but this one does not disappoint. It had everything in it that makes it enjoyable from beginning to end.
Now I only wonder what the real Elisa is doing in the future.

Educating yourself and acquiring knowledge is important. This novella is a fine example of how powerful language can be, and how ignorant people can be easily manipulated by twisting words.

Eric Arthur Blair A.K.A. George Orwell did a great job depicting corrupt human nature while criticizing the...
One word: "Epic"
